pros: A lot of room for advancement.
cons: Small firm with limited guidance.

pros: Really nice coworkers, supervisor, and clients.
cons: Very low morale, high turnover rate. Employees are spread too thin, workload demands are unreasonable. Caseloads are too high which result in a loss of effectiveness. Unreasonable expectations paired with punitive rigid management, makes for a demoralizing work environment. More emphasis put on billing administrative tasks versus helping kids and families. Working here makes you feel like you're apart of some short of elaborate money-making scam under the guise of charity. Not enough training. You are ask to identify and meet underlying needs without a proper framework/therapeutic resources. Too much unnecessary fluff work. Inadequate supervision. Asked to do things for families you're not trained for. Mounds of paperwork and tedious meetings burdens already stressed families. Staff feel unappreciated, unacknowledged, and alienated. No room for upward mobility. Financial strain in the organization fosters an environment of high pressure for productivity/billing. You really don't do anything helpful in your role. You just bring people together families are already working with. Across the board there is a lack progress/meaningful change with clients. It's just a money-making scheme. If you're looking for something rewarding/challenging working with kids, I'd definitely recommend looking for something more legit. Save yourself the agony. Life's too short.

review_title: Absolutely one of the worst service providers in the industry.
pros: Love my co-workers! I can't think of anything else. I'm really trying but I got nothing.
cons: The people making decisions are extremely uniformed and make horrible decisions. Everything is disorganized and done without thinking or consulting the people that have the real answers...meaning the direct service providers. A whole lot of politics, back biting, underhanded meanness. There is no respect for the direct care workers. The services provided to clients are mediocre at best. If the accreditation officers actually knew how negligent services were the cert would be yanked in a minute. Bottom line, I've worked in a lot of areas in mental health and this has been the worst experience I have ever had. I am embarrassed to say I've worked for this agency and it will not be going on my resume. I'd rather have an employment gap than be associated with this level of of professionalism and foolishness. And for the record, I am not a disgruntled employee,  I am held in high regard in my position. I keep my feelings about the company to myself and serve my clients the best I am able under the circumstances.

pros: The best thing about working here is that I'm off on Fridays and weekends.  I'm able to spend quality time with my family on the weekends.
cons: For the labor one put in on the job and the number of hours one has to stand on their feet.....the salary is not sufficient for me to take care of my family and the responsibilities I have at home.  I enjoy working with machines and with people.

review_title: Great Job, great for the community.
job_title: Residential Rehabilitation Specialist in Baltimore, MD
pros: I worked for Alliance years ago, most recently I trusted them with my 18 year old son who requires supportive employment services.  I don't know what better reference I am able to provide.  Alliance offers plenty of room for growth and skill advancement.
cons: At the time, 2004, Alliance did not have a working "family leave act" in place.  This could have been poor managerial practice limited to my division only.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in London, ON
pros: It's a job and it keeps me  from loosing my home for now until I can find something else.  They are great at new hires piles of paperwork and ensuring they cover themselves.  Safety training is mandatory and they again make sure they are covered. The trainer was awesome!
cons: Hired for full time 9 to 5, M-F and still on part time hours and Saturdays.  Broken Promises!

So unprofessional!
